title: Torque and work - omega-t graph and constant tau

content.question: A constant net torque <math alttext="tau sub 0 equals 2 newton meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math> is exerted on a sphere that can rotate about an axis through its center. The graph shows the sphere’s angular velocity <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly describes a method for determining the work done on the sphere by the torque during the <math alttext="delta t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> time interval shown in the <math alttext="omega t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi><mo>‐</mo><mi>t</mi></math> graph?

choices.label: Multiply <math alttext="tau sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> by <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></math>.

Divide <math alttext="tau sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> by the slope of the <math alttext="omega t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi><mo>‐</mo><mi>t</mi></math> graph.
Determine the area under the <math alttext="omega t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi><mo>‐</mo><mi>t</mi></math> graph.

Multiply the area under the <math alttext="omega t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi><mo>‐</mo><mi>t</mi></math> graph by <math alttext="tau sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>.

content.answer: Multiply the area under the <math alttext="omega t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi><mo>‐</mo><mi>t</mi></math> graph by <math alttext="tau sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>.
